sentences.en: ...an Israeli-based fund for survivors of the Holocaust and their families.
sentences.cn: …设在以色列的为纳粹大屠杀的幸存者及其家属建立的基金。

sentences.en: A nuclear holocaust seemed a very real possibility in the '50s.
sentences.cn: 核灾难在20世纪50年代似乎真的非常可能发生。

sentences.en: A nuclear holocaust seemed a very real possibility in the 1950s.
sentences.cn: 核灾难在20世纪50年代似乎真的非常可能发生。

sentences.en: He predicted that there would be a world holocaust.
sentences.cn: 他预言将有一场世界性的浩劫.

sentences.en: It's evident they've discussed the most nightmarish aspects of a nuclear holocaust in their classrooms.
sentences.cn: 显然他们在课堂上讨论过大规模核破坏的最恐怖的方面.

sentences.en: Such a terrible holocaust without parallel in the history of civil wars in our country.
sentences.cn: 此一惨绝人寰之浩劫,实为我国内战史上空前所未有.

sentences.en: Viewing this holocaust , they gave up any hope of living.
sentences.cn: 看见这个奇异的景象, 众人对自己的命运不能够再有丝毫的疑惑了.

trans.tran_en: the killing of millions of Jews and other people by the Nazis during the Second World War
